com.ti.debug.engine.scripting

Class DebugServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ti.ccstudio.scripting.ScriptServer
      • com.ti.debug.engine.scripting.DebugServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IScriptServer

    public class DebugServer
extends com.ti.ccstudio.scripting.ScriptServer
    Open and maintain a connection to the Debugger.

    Note: When specifying file paths during function calls, the slashes need to be represented using '/' or '\\' (with an escape character).

    // Create Environment and open a debug session
    ScriptingEnvironment env = new ScriptingEnvironment();
    DebugServer myServer = (DebugServer) env.getServer("DebugServer.1");
    DebugSession mySession = myServer.openSession("*", "*");

    ...

    // Terminate our session and stop the server
    mySession.terminate()
    myServer.stop()

      • getListOfCPUs

        public java.lang.String[] getListOfCPUs()
        Returns a list of CPU paths that can be use to open a Debug Session. The configuration file (CCXML) that gets analyzed is based on the following rule: 1) use the configuration set by DebugServer.setConfig() if it was called. 2) if not, use the Default CCS target configuration that is set in CCS if using the Scripting Console 3) if no configuration is found, returns null array Usage: String[] cpuList = DebugServer.getListOfCPUs(); DebugSession session1 = DebugServer.openSession(cpuList[0]); ...
        Returns:
        String[] the list of CPU paths for the current configuration

      • openSession

        public DebugSession openSession()
                         throws ScriptingException
        Open a debug session. This zero-parameter convenience method assumes a single device is configured and will open a connection to that device. If more than one device is configured, an exception will be thrown.
        Returns:
        DebugSession object connected to the only configured target.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • openSession

        public DebugSession openSession(java.lang.String sPattern)
                         throws ScriptingException
        In the system configuration, each debuggable object (CPU) has a unique name that is constructed as: boardname/CPUName

        This method will open a DebugSession to a single debuggable object (CPU) by specifying a regular expression. There must be exactly one match.

        If you have multiple CPUs in your configuration, you can open multiple DebugSessions as required. Each DebugSession will be connected to a single CPU.

        Parameters:
        sPattern - regular expression
        Returns:
        DebugSession connected to the debuggable object (CPU) specified
        Throws:
        ScriptingException - if there is a parsing error with the regular expression or if an exact match was not found

      • openSession

        public DebugSession openSession(java.lang.String sBoardName,
                                java.lang.String sCPUName)
                         throws ScriptingException
        Open a connection to the debugger. Specify the board name and CPU name to open a single configured CPU. The specified target must already be configured in CCStudio Setup prior to calling this method.

        This method also allows the passing of wildcards "*" to sBoardName and sCPUName. A wildcard will match the first found target:

        // Open a connection to the target with the board name
        // "C55x Texas Instruments", CPU name "CPU_1"
        session = server.openSession("C55x Texas Instruments", "CPU_1")

        // Open a connection to the target with the board name
        // "C55x Texas Instruments", CPU name "CPU_2"
        session = server.openSession("C55x Texas Instruments", "CPU_2")

        // Open a connection to the first CPU of the board named
        // "C64xx XDS560 Emulator"
        session = server.openSession("C64xx XDS560 Emulator", "*")

        // Open a connection to the first CPU of the first board
        // Note: Don't use this if there is a chance that CCStudio Setup will
        // have more than one board configured - as this will always open the
        // first board and may cause unpredictable results in your script.
        session = server.openSession"*", "*")

        Parameters:
        sBoardName - the name of the target board in CCStudio Setup. Pass "*" to this parameter to match the first configured board.
        sCPUName - the name of the target CPU in CCStudio Setup. Pass "*" to this parameter to match the first CPU of the board specified in sBoardName.
        Returns:
        DebugSession object connected to the specified target.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • removeListener

      • setDefaultDialogResponse

        public void setDefaultDialogResponse(java.lang.String choice)
                              throws ScriptingException
        Sets the default response for dialogs. When a dialog is shown, it will respond using the choice that is set.

        The function can be called multiple times to change the default choice at the current time, but needs to be called before an API call that will bring up a dialog.

        Note that "Retry" is a special case, and that it will only try it 10 times before setting the response to "Cancel". This prevents it from retrying infinitely. Also note that this API only works when there are no other listeners (ie;CCS) to the dialog
        Parameters:
        choice - - the String corresponding to the choice to make. For example, "Ignore" "Cancel" "Retry" Please refer to the dialog buttons in the GUI to find out the choices available for the current dialog.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • testConnection

        public void testConnection()
                    throws ScriptingException

        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • unsetDefaultDialogResponse

        public void unsetDefaultDialogResponse()
        Unsets the default response for dialogs. This will make it so that the debugger will use the default response (which is usually "Cancel")

        The function is only needed if the user has called setDefaultDialogResponse().
